meanings.definition: Misleared (verb): to teach incorrectly or poorly
meanings.sent1: The teacher misleared the students by giving them the wrong information.
meanings.sent2: She realized she misleared her little brother about the bedtime story.
meanings.sent3: The misleared instructions on the puzzle box led to a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His misleared directions caused him to wander aimlessly in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The misleared map made the journey more challenging than expected.

meanings.sent1: The misleared students struggled to understand the complex math problem.
meanings.sent2: She felt frustrated by the misleared information in the confusing manual.
meanings.sent3: The misleared recipe resulted in a surprisingly tasty dish.
meanings.sent4: His misleared understanding of the game rules led to constant mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The misleared class left the students feeling unprepared for the exam.
